thread.title: Trump border wall: Mexico hints it will start trade war over 'wall levy' plans | World | News | Express.co.uk
thread.title_full: Trump border wall: Mexico hints it will start trade war over 'wall levy' plans | World | News | Express.co.uk

author: Fraser Moore
title: Trump border wall: Mexico hints it will start trade war over 'wall levy' plans | World | News | Express.co.uk
text:
Mexican president Pena Nieto last month cancelled a visit to President Trump 
“The Mexican government would have to respond.” 
Officials were angered after rumours emerged that the construction of the 2,000-mile barrier would see the Mexican government stripped of any US financial aid. GETTY Trump has said he will use a 20 per cent levy on Mexican goods to pay for a border wall The Mexican government would have to respond Luis Videgaray 
Trump’s January 25 executive order mandating the construction of the wall – estimated to cost £17.3billion ($21.6 billion) – would also require US agencies to report any financial assistance they gave Mexico in the past five years. 
Washington gives Mexico an estimated $586million per year in financial support, according to US foreign aid agency USAID. 
The strengthening of the Mexican stance against the US comes after president Pena Nieto last month cancelled a visit to meet President Trump over the border wall row. 
The US have a £48.5billion ($61billion) trade surplus with Mexico. What a month for President Trump! Fri, February 24, 2017
